content:
When rewatching Ewout's presentation on bringing the .NET SDK to the cloud I noticed the Audit Transcript turned "HAPI SDK" into Hoppy SDK. This in turn started a conversation about FHIR Beer.

My initial thoughts on FHIR Beer:
An IPA with 4 types of Hops:

  • Falconer's Flight Hops
  • Herald Hops
  • Idaho 7 Hops
  • Riwaka Hops
    Call it "The FHIR IPA"

Got the hop types from morebeer.com
Maybe @Dave Shaver is still reading this, he might want to chime in ;-)
image-8.png

Matthijs van der Wielen said:

When rewatching Ewout's presentation on bringing the .NET SDK to the cloud I noticed the Audit Transcript turned "HAPI SDK" into Hoppy SDK. This in turn started a conversation about FHIR Beer.

My initial thoughts on FHIR Beer:
An IPA with 4 types of Hops:

  • Falconer's Flight Hops
  • Herald Hops
  • Idaho 7 Hops
  • Riwaka Hops
    Call it "The FHIR IPA"

Got the hop types from morebeer.com

Cool! We launched the Hot Beverage IG on April 1st, so now only 8 weeks later we are already covering cold beverages, thus spanning the entire spectrum of temperatures. http://build.fhir.org/ig/DavidPyke/HotBeverage/branches/master/index.html
@David Pyke What's your take on this? Two separate IGs, each for its own range of temperature? Or a unified "Beverage IG"?
I'm starting to think we need a library of abstract profiles for beverage that can be used as a base for all beverage IGs into the future.

David Pyke said:

I'm starting to think we need a library of abstract profiles for beverage that can be used as a base for all beverage IGs into the future.

LiquidDefinition?
That would have to have a matching LiquidOrder. FHIR Bartending will be a thing...

David Pyke said:

That would have to have a matching LiquidOrder. FHIR Bartending will be a thing...

Or just realise that in the end it is all Over-the-Counter medication and use the medication profiles? Is hops an active ingredient?
Hops would be a substance. But that's more about the brewing so, we'd need to start a full beverage subset that borrows from Medications.

I'm still frustrated with the inability to specify that a profile is derived from multiple other profiles. I've been trying to make SpanishCoffee all day, and can't figure out how to indicate my beverage conforms with both the Coffee profile and the Kaluha one.
I guess my Whisky IG is going to have to focus on single malts, not blends too.
use composition not derivation
Beverage.hasMember?
already handled in the medicinal stuff
And then tasks for the workflow -- water/hops/yeast, wait (ferment), bottle, drink, (sleep - maybe), and repeat. ;-)

"When rewatching Ewout's presentation on bringing the .NET SDK to the cloud I noticed the Audit Transcript turned "HAPI SDK" into Hoppy SDK. This in turn started a conversation about FHIR Beer." - Do you have a link to this? Is it one of the Dev days presentations?

Elliot Silver said:

I'm still frustrated with the inability to specify that a profile is derived from multiple other profiles. I've been trying to make SpanishCoffee all day, and can't figure out how to indicate my beverage conforms with both the Coffee profile and the Kaluha one.

HotBeverage already has an element to add alcohol of your choice. You don't need to cross IGs for this.

Adam Flinton said:

"When rewatching Ewout's presentation on bringing the .NET SDK to the cloud I noticed the Audit Transcript turned "HAPI SDK" into Hoppy SDK. This in turn started a conversation about FHIR Beer." - Do you have a link to this? Is it one of the Dev days presentations?

This was indeed one of the presentations of last week's DevDays. They are available for participants - and will be available publicly 6 months after DevDays. Which means last DevDay's presentations are now online for everyone: https://chat.fhir.org/#narrow/stream/179240-Announcements/topic/DevDays
Tasks assigned for everyone to drink one? Or ServiceRequest?
I guess it depends if you are 'self-medicating' or it's being prescribed! ;-)
